snippet.textDisplay:
I had the same bias for the char. designs too, but believe me, this game is worth every dollar... or pound or euro, wherever you live :b 
  The amazing landscapes accompanied by the beautiful soundtrack will keep you playing the game all the way till the ending credits. And the game has plenty of sidequests, which have branching paths so there's even a lot of replayabilty with this already huge game.
  The only complain I have is the lack of multiplayer. A great game, nonetheless.
snippet.textOriginal:
I had the same bias for the char. designs too, but believe me, this game is worth every dollar... or pound or euro, wherever you live :b 
  The amazing landscapes accompanied by the beautiful soundtrack will keep you playing the game all the way till the ending credits. And the game has plenty of sidequests, which have branching paths so there's even a lot of replayabilty with this already huge game.
  The only complain I have is the lack of multiplayer. A great game, nonetheless.

snippet.textDisplay: I love the music and I loved the nintendo direct. The Wii U has been used everyday in my house. I love it and even though I knew most of the games were coming it's good to hear concrete evidence. This X game looks like a no brainer to purchase and be stoked about.

snippet.textDisplay: It certainly got my attention. Lots of cool things announced for the Wii U which honestly will only be a secondary console to me much like the Wii was but it's nice to know some of the potential games that should be of high quality when I pick up the system 2-3 years from now.

Lots of cool things announced for the Wii U which honestly will only be a secondary console to me much like the Wii was but it's nice to know some of the potential games that should be of high quality when I pick up the system 2-3 years from now.

snippet.textDisplay: I actually have this game, though I have had very little time to play it, but from what I have played, the game is excellent and the music really fits all the areas.  As for the Wii U, I won't be getting one until they iron out most of the issues.
snippet.textOriginal: I actually have this game, though I have had very little time to play it, but from what I have played, the game is excellent and the music really fits all the areas.  As for the Wii U, I won't be getting one until they iron out most of the issues.

snippet.textDisplay: That really looked like Shulk at the end of the trailer, but I'm sure this is more of a spiritual successor than a sequel. One can hope though. Although, when you think about it, that could have been Klaus/Zanza since he has the same face as Shulk, like some kind of origin story? I know XB's ending and backstory don't really give room for that, but I thought that might be a cool idea.
snippet.textOriginal: That really looked like Shulk at the end of the trailer, but I'm sure this is more of a spiritual successor than a sequel. One can hope though. Although, when you think about it, that could have been Klaus/Zanza since he has the same face as Shulk, like some kind of origin story? I know XB's ending and backstory don't really give room for that, but I thought that might be a cool idea.

snippet.textDisplay:
I thought Smash was the reason to get a Wii U.
And then today happened.
Between this and Shin Megami Tensei X Fire Emblem, the Wii U just made a lot of people happy. I can name countless friends of mine who said the Wii U was stupid, that today are storming Facebook with "I GOT A WII U! CAN'T WAIT FOR *insert one of today's announced games*"
snippet.textOriginal:
I thought Smash was the reason to get a Wii U.
And then today happened.
Between this and Shin Megami Tensei X Fire Emblem, the Wii U just made a lot of people happy. I can name countless friends of mine who said the Wii U was stupid, that today are storming Facebook with "I GOT A WII U! CAN'T WAIT FOR *insert one of today's announced games*"

snippet.textDisplay: How about that new X game announced by Monolith Soft?﻿ The trailer actually gave me goosebumps once the music got epic and the mechs were showed. It really looks like it's Xenoblade 2. I'll miss the music by ACE+ and the rest, but the game seems to be in good hands with Hiroyuki Sawano. It just felt really good to finally see a game from Nintendo﻿ that uses the Wii U's much better graphics capabilities.
snippet.textOriginal: How about that new X game announced by Monolith Soft?﻿ The trailer actually gave me goosebumps once the music got epic and the mechs were showed. It really looks like it's Xenoblade 2. I'll miss the music by ACE+ and the rest, but the game seems to be in good hands with Hiroyuki Sawano. It just felt really good to finally see a game from Nintendo﻿ that uses the Wii U's much better graphics capabilities.
